author: Mark Anderson
title: Citizen Hotel checks into Marriott reservation system, opening up new market
text:
Dennis McCoy | Sacramento Business Journal The Citizen Hotel in downtown Sacramento is now part of the the Marriott reservation… more The Citizen Hotel in downtown Sacramento on Tuesday made a big move. Affiliated since it opened in 2008 with the Joie de Vivre hotel chain, it joined the Marriott Hotels and Resorts reservation system. The 14-story hotel’s reservation system on Tuesday went live as a property in the Autograph Collection, the boutique brand of Marriott International Inc. (Nasdaq: MAR). With 198 rooms and the trendy Grange restaurant, the Citizen was converted into a hotel from a historic 1925 office building. Joining the Marriott brand makes the Citizen part of one the world’s largest international hotel reservation systems. It also is the first full-service Marriott-branded hotel in downtown Sacramento. The move also means that guests staying at the Citizen earn Marriott Rewards, the popular reward program for frequent travelers. The Citizen was recently sold by its developers , Cal West Partners, a limited partnership managed by Rubicon Partners Inc. of Sacramento. No price was disclosed on the sale. The new owner is Sacramento Hotel LLC, a limited liability corporation that will be managed by Beverly Hills-based investment firm Platinum Equity.
